description.narrative: Zimbabwe:Works is preparing the countrys marginalized young people to enter the workforce. With initial funding from USAID and an additional commitment from DFID and the Embassy of Sweden (Sida), this initiative has brought the International Youth Foundation into partnership with local NGOs and companies to provide critical job readiness training. The project also helps future entrepreneurs succeed in self-employment through business coursework and access to microfinance loans and savings and loan programs. Through use of locally adapted Passport to Success curriculum, the project is empowering young Zimbabweans with life skills such as increased self-esteem, and promoting civic engagement. Throughout the initiative, which is a part of the global Youth:Work framework, the project's capacity building work guides local partners to develop the business acumen to succeed and operate sustainably.
